Articles.Content:
The first successful SSTO I've ever produced. Slightly resembles the SR-71, hence the title.

I've constructed three separate variants, a cargo, and docking variant, as well as one capable of holding 6 Kerbals. :(:(

As far as my capability goes flying the craft I was able to get this thing into a stable 100KM orbit. I have yet to stress test each variant, but will plan on doing so in the future.

The Cargo Variant : http://i.imgur.com/A1aJSL5.jpg

Download : https://www.dropbox.com/s/07gk6zyehuiggrj/SR-81%20SSTO%20Cargo%20Variant.craft?dl=0

The Docking Variant : http://i.imgur.com/YKY8G7X.jpg

Download : https://www.dropbox.com/s/xhndw0cxv6nbkbb/SR-81%20SSTO%20Docking%20Variant.craft?dl=0

The Passenger Variant : http://i.imgur.com/ysyaWti.jpg

Download : https://www.dropbox.com/s/irh1e6reo1ojkh1/SR-81%20SSTO%20Kerbal%20Variant.craft?dl=0

Eye Candy : http://i.imgur.com/ZR7mfha.jpg http://i.imgur.com/3gRp3Rv.jpg

Being my first ever post, I'm open to any critic, either on the quality of the craft or the forum post.

Thanks!

-KrunchyKittens

Those crafts look cool!

Did you manage to do some orbital transfers or deorbit?

Cause I want to know how much fuel it has after reaching orbit.

(mine looks a bit more like the SR-71 check out my signature (no offensive) )

Edited October 14, 2014 by deepspacecreeper

Just now, I did. I've got photos, too!

http://i.imgur.com/cWsoQWb.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/sJnGpmL.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/PrWfSoJ.jpg

This was all one mission, I was able to deploy a little probe from the cargo bay, then rendezvous with a little station I had setup beforehand.

One suggestion before trying the craft out, I may have screwed up the landing gear a bit. Replacement should be easy, but it likes to lose control on takeoff now.

A quick tweak fixed it.

Some aircraft tend to veer off the runway while taking off for no reason. I still don't know why. It just happens.

Did you keep the Kerbals in a pod inside the cargo bay? (other than those at the flight deck)

Edited October 14, 2014 by deepspacecreeper

I did not. The plane had plenty of fuel to spare after the rendezvous, though. Enough to deorbit, and land. It could definitely handle a heavier payload.

I'm gonna hit the hay, so I'll talk to you later.
